subject: Re: Request for Dev support - mstrials.org.au
preview: Hi Karlo, Perfect, we are standing by. In regards to internal links, yes, that is exactly the process we use during switch over.

action.text: Rica Rosario Valencia marked as Closed

full_threads.body:
Hi Karlo, 

Perfect, we are standing by. 

In regards to internal links, yes, that is exactly the process we use during switch over.

Thanks Chris.

Sounds good. I'll let you know when ready. Approx a month from today.

Sorry another question - so all my internal links are currently pointing to https://staging-mstrials.kinsta.cloud/XXXXX - am I right in saying that I should just leave it as is and simply do a search and replace it with https://mstrials.org.au/XXXXX when we are ready to switch over?

Thanks
Karlo

Karlo Aliling​

Design Lead

MS Australia

1300 010 158

karlo.aliling@msaustralia.org.au

•

http://www.msaustralia.org.au/

PO Box 625 • North Sydney NSW 2059

Hi Karlo, 

Thanks for the detailed info and you are most welcome. 

Understood regarding the regular posts. From the Dashboard, I can see you have 55 published posts. We can handle the transfer of these of these for you as part of your monthly support. You may wish to transfer the un-published posts to have access to them if needed. At present, there isn't a bulk transfer option available, but we can complete the works in a rapid manner.

Hi Chris,

I've started working on the staging server. Thanks for setting that up.

Currently, there is still a regular updating of posts on the live site (https://mstrials.org.au/wp-admin/edit.php) which can't pause while I'm working on the redesign.

Once I've completed post templates etc in the staging server, is there a way to export all posts (from the old site) to the staging site before we go live? Assuming that I will delete all posts in the staging site before doing an export-import.

Thanks
Karlo

Karlo Aliling​

Design Lead

MS Australia

1300 010 158

karlo.aliling@msaustralia.org.au

•

http://www.msaustralia.org.au/

PO Box 625 • North Sydney NSW 2059

Hi Karlo, 

Great news, the staging server is up and running, you can access it here: https://staging-mstrials.kinsta.cloud/

In a few moments, you should receive an invite to reset your PW, please do so at your earliest convenience. 

We are standing by to assist as needed.

full_threads.body: @chris @ricaR here is the latest staging https://staging-mstrials.kinsta.cloud/ please forget the password in order to access it.

action.text: Rica Rosario Valencia assigned to Manuel Lito Manceli

full_threads.body:
Hi Rica,

Please see below request from Karlo at mstrials.org.au

Can you please assign to Manuel?

@Manuel, all we need to do for now is to set up a staging server. Karlo will ask us for support when required.

Hi Chris,

Thanks for the clarification. Yes, can we proceed with the staging server?

Thank you
Karlo

Sent: Friday, 13 October 2023 9:56 AM
To: Karlo Aliling <karlo.aliling@msaustralia.org.au <mailto:karlo.aliling@msaustralia.org.au>>
Cc: Sarah Morrison <sarah.morrison@msaustralia.org.au <mailto:sarah.morrison@msaustralia.org.au>>
Subject: Re: Request for Dev support - mstrials.org.au <http://mstrials.org.au/>

Hi Karlo,

It’s no trouble at all. The only thing to remember is that when a staging server is used all updates on the live domain need to be paused.

A staging server provides you with significantly more freedom to test without affecting the live domain.

Also great to read about moving from WP Bakery to Elementor!

Please let me know if you'd like to set up the staging server and I will loop back with access.

Regards,



Chris Paradowski
Partnerships Manager
Wolf IQ Pty Ltd

1300 072 134 <tel:1300 072 134> | 0421 859 547 <tel:0421 859 547>

> On 13 Oct 2023, at 10:30 am, Karlo Aliling <karlo.aliling@msaustralia.org.au <mailto:karlo.aliling@msaustralia.org.au>> wrote:
>
> Thanks Chris!
>
> Yes, I'm actually working on it on the live domain but all are unlisted. Simply because it's a fairly small site and it just has always been what I was used to doing. Not quite sure how much work is involved on your end if we create a staging server but I'll be guided by your recommendations. I just need to be in the position to switch over as soon as the team signs off.
>
> Basically, all I'm doing is rebuilding the current site into Elementor - using pretty much the same content. And eventually removing WPBakery.
>
> Thanks
> Karlo
